original_title: Anti-Corruption Bill to be presented to Parliament
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Minister of Justice Dr. Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe said the Anti-Corruption Draft Bill will be presented to Parliament once again on Thursday (06), to be passed.
It was presented to Parliament and debated on the 21st of June, however it was not passed.
The Justice Minister said the draft bill for the Protection of Victims of Crime and Witnesses Act will also be presented to Parliament on Thursday (06) for approval.
The Netherlands to return looted artifacts from Sri Lanka in Colonial era
